intro: Koanophyllon tripartitum, commonly known as the three-parted dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as hairy leaves to reduce water loss. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The leaves are deeply lobed and arranged in a triangular pattern, giving the plant its common name.
